parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions USR and PNL, both parliamentary candidates.  It also implicitly refers to PSD by suggesting a connection between voting for USR/PNL and voting for PSD. This directly relates to Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The post's message is not a private communication but aims for broader dissemination. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections. The statement "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!" directly aims to dissuade voters from supporting USR and PNL by associating them with PSD, a potentially negative association for some voters. This clearly fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It doesn't present factual information, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it presents a biased and potentially misleading statement intended to sway voters' opinions.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post might represent the author's opinion, it's presented as a declarative statement rather than a personal reflection. The phrasing is assertive and aims to directly influence voter behavior, exceeding the bounds of personal opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>615078284376981</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, with the message "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!", constitutes electoral propaganda.  It directly refers to specific parliamentary candidates (USR, PNL, and implicitly PSD), targets a wide audience through a paid advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters' choices. The statement is presented as a fact, not an opinion, and lacks journalistic neutrality. The post's timing, after the official campaign period, further strengthens the case for a violation.  While the post doesn't explicitly advocate for or against a specific candidate, its implication is to negatively influence voters' perception of USR and PNL, potentially benefiting another party.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Claudiu-Iorga Palaz, pentru incalcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea pe Facebook, dupa ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei reclame platite cu mesajul "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!",  care constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale. Mesajul, vizibil pe postarea cu ID-ul 615078284376981,  face referire directă la candidații USR și PNL, sugerând o asociere negativă cu PSD, având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a votului pentru USR și PNL și implicit, o influență pozitivă asupra PSD.  Această afirmație, lipsită de neutralitate jurnalistică și prezentată ca un fapt, nu ca o opinie, urmărește influențarea directă a alegătorilor, încălcând prevederile legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
